issues.description: The template's commented Main example calls farm.feed(), while the problem statement and the intended solution specify the method name feedAllAnimals(). This name mismatch can confuse students about which method to implement and may lead them to create a feed() method that does not match the exercise specification or the tests (which expect feedAllAnimals()).
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template Main.java commented example to call farm.feedAllAnimals() (or otherwise align the example with the problem statement). This removes the naming ambiguity and ensures students implement the method name expected by the specification and tests.

issues.description: The problem statement and the reference solution define and use a method named feedAllAnimals() to feed all animals on the farm. However, the template repository's Main.java (commented example) calls farm.feed() instead. This is a naming mismatch for the same conceptual operation (feeding all animals) and may mislead students when mapping the exercise description to the starter code — they may search for or implement the wrong method name.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository to use the same method name as the problem statement and solution. In template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java replace the call to farm.feed() with farm.feedAllAnimals(), or alternatively add a feed() method in the template Farm that delegates to feedAllAnimals(), but the simpler fix is to align the template Main to call feedAllAnimals().
